intro: Cananga pseudolancea, commonly known as the false torchwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
